mobs.long_desc: A young player is here, looking confused about his identity.
mobs.desc: Deceptively innocent, this player is trying to figure out who he is.  He mutters to himself about his possible choices about giving in to the affections of his fellow player.

mobs.long_desc: A wildly flamboyant player parades about, proclaiming his cuteness.
mobs.desc: This player is very cute, like a puppy or kitten would be, in that way that just makes you want to kick him.  He is totally oblivious to anything else, living along in the fantasy world in his head.

mobs.long_desc: A player flirts shamelessly with a fellow player.
mobs.desc: Subtly stroking his long, black hair, this is a player who just doesn't realize that the world doesn't revolve around him.  He tries everything he can to get people to do what he wants, even if he doesn't always succeed.

mobs.long_desc: A player lounges around, badmouthing her sister.
mobs.desc: While being outwardly nice, this player is actually quite nasty and cold-hearted.  While not realizing that she behaves exactly as her sister does, she insults her sibling at every turn.

mobs.long_desc: A player runs around panicked, shouting orders at people.
mobs.desc: This girl doesn't quite understand that she doesn't run the show.  Her constant shouting and complaining about how no one is doing what they're supposed to be doing and how her sister is a demon gets very tiring, very quickly.  You begin to wish that someone would shut her up.

mobs.long_desc: The Dance Captain struts about, attracting as much attention as she can.
mobs.desc: This beautiful woman has true talent but she doesn't know it.  While not a leading role in the show, the social world of the troupe revolves entirely around her.  Though she seems conceited, you get the impression she's actually very sweet at heart.

mobs.long_desc: A timid little player is here, mourning the loss of a boyfriend.
mobs.desc: A player new to this troupe, this player has lost her boyfriend to another player!  She cries occasionally, but angrily picks herself up, knowing that she has to dance, and dance PERFECTLY!!  OR ELSE!!

mobs.long_desc: The Queen of Melodrama stresses about something unimportant.
mobs.desc: This player struts about, hand to her forehead, dramatically mourning the world and everything that is.  Of course, the fact that she has recently acquired someone else's significant other is unimportant at the moment, since the world just sucks.

mobs.long_desc: A scary rabid monkey swings down from the rafters and attacks!
mobs.desc: This furry creature screams at you as it tries to steal your equipment to add to its junk heap.  A little brown monkey, you wonder how it got way up here. The slight glimmer of intelligence in its eye suggests that maybe there is more to this creature than meets the eye!

mobs.long_desc: A scared little creature peeks out to look at you and runs back in to hiding!
mobs.desc: This little gnome hides behind chairs and set pieces until the lights go out so it can build the sets and make repairs.  When it sees you have spotted it, it jumps up and hides!

mobs.long_desc: A little boy follows his mother around.
mobs.desc: A small boy follows his frantic mother around.  He looks very upset, like something he wants very badly is being denied to him.

mobs.keywords: goddess fire-goddess player rachel flame worried
mobs.long_desc: A player dressed like a brilliant flame is here, looking worried.
mobs.desc: A ravishingly beautiful woman with bright blonde hair, pale skin and a gorgeous skirt looks for someone.  She carries a torch in one hand, which seems to be made of paper and foil, but still gives off light like fire.

mobs.long_desc: A man chasing after his dreams rambles about.
mobs.desc: This man has no idea where he is going, or what he wants to do with his life. All he knows is that he is destined for something great and he is determined to find it.  A plain man, he is a first-time player who has just received the honor of this great role.

mobs.long_desc: A humble player waits for her cue.
mobs.desc: Humble and kind, this player is a simple woman who doesn't really want anything more than to perform.  Much quieter than all her other troupe members, she simply gives a polite smile, just being happy to be here.

mobs.long_desc: A flamboyant player is here, looking confused.
mobs.desc: The very definition of male beauty, this man is just gorgeous.  He obviously spends a lot of time working out and playing athletic games, though right now something more important seems to be on his mind.

mobs.keywords: catherine woman lauren average ordinary mother
mobs.long_desc: An average, ordinary kind of woman with a kid searches around frantically.
mobs.desc: Catherine is a simple looking woman, but beautiful in her own, ordinary way. Though she is in costume and ready to go on, she seems to be missing something. Not the calmest person in the world, she runs frantically around the theatre for whatever it is she needs.

mobs.long_desc: An actor of enormous power, dressed as Charlemagne, waits for his cue.
mobs.desc: This powerful player has a fierce air about him, strong and violent.  He fits the image of Emperor perfectly, looking like he himself has seen a war or two in his time.  His beautiful purple cloak accents his rough, masculine features, making him almost statuesque.

mobs.long_desc: The player in the role of Fastrada rests here coolly.
mobs.desc: A beautiful but sinister looking woman, this player has really gotten into her role.  She knows what she wants and isn't afraid to get it.  The cool feel about her makes her even more intimidating than she would be normally. Through the appearance of being and ordinary housewife and mother, it's obvious that she is quite capable of taking care of herself.

mobs.long_desc: The leader of the House Gnomes watches over the theatre.
mobs.desc: The House Gnome King is the oldest and wisest of the House Gnomes.  He watches his people and instructs them on how to do their job, helping as much as possible in making sure the theatre runs smoothly.  This theatre is his kingdom, where he rules with a watchful eye.

mobs.long_desc: An unfinished mob stands here.
mobs.desc: It looks unfinished.

mobs.keywords: leading-player master leader phil lp2 player2 leading2
mobs.long_desc: The Leading Player sits casually at his desk, his legs crossed.
mobs.desc: This gorgeous man leers at you with an almost demonic grin.  He more than enjoys his job; he revels in it.  Not a single thing occurs in the theatre without him noticing.  As muscular as he is lithe, he is the perfect embodiment of what every performer aspires to be.

mobs.keywords: player leading leading-player master leader phil
mobs.long_desc: The Leading Player, leader of the troupe and master of this theatre, stands before you.
mobs.desc: This gorgeous man leers at you with an almost demonic grin.  He more than enjoys his job; he revels in it.  Not a single thing occurs in the theatre without him noticing.  As muscular as he is lithe, he is the perfect embodiment of what every performer aspires to be.

objects.ground: A small brass key is here.

extras.text: This brass key has the name 'Lewis' inscribed on it.

objects.ground: A small steel key is here.

extras.text: This steel key has the name 'Charlemagne' inscribed on it.

objects.ground: A small gold key is here.

extras.text: This gold key has the name 'Fastrada' inscribed on it.

objects.ground: A small silver key is here

extras.text: This silver key has the name 'Catherine' inscribed on it.

objects.ground: A small iron key is here.

extras.text: This key belongs to the house gnomes.  They use it to lock and unlock the trapdoor in the shop behind the stage.

objects.ground: A large belt hung with shiny ribbons and cloth lies here in a heap.

extras.text: This mass of ribbons is actually a very pretty full-length skirt that looks like a large blossom of fire.  Reds, golds, yellows and oranges make up this impromptu sash, which while not very graceful, is very pretty.

objects.ground: An elegant green dress has been quickly discarded in a heap on the ground.

extras.text: Made of beautiful green satin and trimmed with gold, this dress is a very beautiful piece of work.  Obviously used in several productions, small stains mar the perfection and places where the seams have had to be re-sewed are apparent.

objects.ground: A black shirt sits here in a ball on the floor.

extras.text: This shirt is smaller than a normal shirt.  It's totally black, except on the back where the word 'TECH' is spelled out in white letters.  You wonder who would wear something like this.

objects.ground: Peeking out from behind the mirror is a picture of someone in the troupe...

extras.text: The player with the long hair is pictured in this small sketch.  There's a sensual look to the sketch, almost like a special message between secret lovers.

objects.ground: A stuffed toy duck stares at you.

extras.text: This big fluffy duck looks like the perfect gift to make a young child happy. For a moment, you think about how much fun it would be to have a toy like this. Why such a thing would ever be part of a show though you don't even want to know.

objects.ground: Someone left their makeup kit behind.

extras.text: This kit has everything an actor needs; base, blush, eyeliner, lipstick, highlights and shadows and even a stubble sponge.  Cheap and simple, but it covers all of an actor's base needs.

objects.ground: At your feet sits a glittery ring tied with ribbons and fabric.

extras.text: This simple sharp metal ring has been painted and tied with strips of ribbon and pieces of fabric to give it a fiery look.  It looks like a nice prop and a decent weapon too.

objects.ground: A full-body leotard has been laid out, ready for a performance.

extras.text: This simple black uniform covers your whole body from neck to legs.  It's quite a snug fit, showing every curve and line on your body.

objects.short: a pair of black dance shoes
objects.ground: Sprawled in the middle of the floor are a pair of black shoes.

extras.text: These simple black shoes give good support to your feet for quick, flowing movement.

objects.ground: A beautiful shimmering piece of fabric hangs loosely in the wind.

extras.text: A shimmering piece of fabric, this sash fades from dark yellow and gold to burnt orange to a deep blood red, imitating fire.  It would look very sultry draped around someone's waist.

objects.short: a pair of tight black leggings
objects.ground: Some tightly fitting black leggings are hung over a chair here.

extras.text: These black leggings fit snugly over your legs and lower body.  Though they don't give much protection, they do allow for an unrestricted range of motion, as well as a sleek look.

objects.ground: A very unusual prop torch glows softly in the shadows.

extras.text: This beautifully crafted torch glows with magical properties.  This is obviously more than a simple stage prop.

objects.ground: Hovering in the air is a glittering metal ring, wreathed in flames.

extras.text: A reward for completing a single, perfect act, this weapon is as deadly as it is entrancing.  The flames around the ring leap and swirl, dancing in an almost hypnotic pattern.  Though the ring gives off light and heat, it isn't hot enough to burn your hand when you touch it.  The flames wrap around your fist, joining you with the ring in one perfect flame.

objects.ground: A beautiful shimmering piece of fabric hangs loosely in the wind.

extras.text: A shimmering piece of fabric, this sash fades from dark yellow and gold to burnt orange to a deep blood red, imitating fire.  It would look very sultry draped around someone's waist.

objects.ground: An enormous black box stands behind the curtain.

extras.text: This thing is actually a towering black box.  There is a hook to one side of what looks like a door, which looks like it could hold a torch or something. The box is completely black and smells faintly of sulfur.  The door looks big enough that you could step into the box if you really wanted to.

objects.short: the flaming wreckage of the fire box
objects.ground: The wreckage of the fire box has collapsed on the stage, burning.

extras.text: This flaming pile of rubble is all that's left of a single, perfect moment; all that remains of one man's search for ultimate fulfillment.  Even as a pile of wreckage, the burning remains still contain some of the illustrious power of the Finale.  Perhaps that burning is enough to spark the flames in the hearts of other men...

objects.ground: A beautiful steel breastplate has been propped up in the corner.

extras.text: A shining plate, made of pressed felt and painted to look like steel, decorated with elaborate designs, looks like it might actually hold up well in combat. Sculpted to fight a very well muscled warrior, this plate is a bit larger than a normal one.  This isn't an item you would normally think of as a stage prop.

objects.ground: Someone has forgotten their fake eyelashes here.

extras.text: These simple fake eyelashes can make a woman's eyes look darker and more beautiful.  These brand-new eyelashes are fresh out of the box, pristine in condition.  They would make anyone look more attractive.

objects.ground: A large steel sword rests on the ground.

extras.text: This steel sword is very well made, strong and definitely ready for battle. Bearing the crest of Charlemagne the Great, this sword actually seems authentic.  Polished and shining like the sun, it is quite a beautiful weapon.

objects.ground: An exquisite golden crown has been dropped here.

extras.text: An elaborate, but feminine, golden crown set with emeralds, this is the crown of a queen.  Made of real gems and gold, you have to wonder why it is just a prop in a show and how an acting troupe could afford such a treasure.

objects.short: a bouquet of red silk roses
objects.ground: A bouquet of red silk flowers has been left behind on the counter.

extras.text: These fake roses have a little knob at the bottom that when turned, pulls the flowers in and out of the stems, making them appear to magically bloom. Though a very nice stage prop, they can't actually be worth more than two or three silver.

objects.ground: Purple velvet has been left here, forming a soft golden-edged pool on the floor.

extras.text: From a distance, this cloak is perfect in detail, but when viewed up close, it clearly fits the phrase 'good enough for stage'.  It's still quite a piece of work though, lined in darker purple silk and trimmed in gold.  A golden cord clasped in a large brooch ties the cloak to the wearer's neck.

objects.ground: An old dusty script sits in a chest here, untouched for many years.

extras.text: Notes are scribbled all over the margins for helping old Berthe remember decades of blocking, timing, line readings, and word changes.  Thumbing through, you notice the text is faded in places from all the underlining and changes making it hard to read anything through.  One passage, circled many, many times still stands out though: &7&b"... I believe if I refuse to grow old, I can stay young til I die..."&0 Maybe this would be a good line to perform for your audition.

objects.ground: One of the legendary rings of health has been misplaced here.
An unfinished object is lying here.
An ancient spellbook holding all the spells in existence hovers here.

extras.text: This book is said to contain the very magic of the gods themselves.

objects.ground: A set of sparking electrum knuckles crackles in the dust.

extras.text: Fighting knuckles like these are a set of four rings, fused in a line to fit the four primary fingers of the human hand.  This particular set is made out of electrum, an extremely rare alloy of gold and silver with traces of copper and other metals, known for its alchemical resonance with thunder and lightning. Inscribed on each ring is a different alchemical symbol: an upward-pointed triangle with a horizontal line for air; a three-angled line with a downward pointing arrow for lightning; a circle with an up-right pointed cone joined by an inverted moon for electrum; and a right-facing C-shaped curve bisected by a bent line for thunder.

objects.ground: A screaming knife devours the light here.

extras.text: Twisted Chaos is a work of clear beauty and pain.  This knife has a sturdy but warped haft, grooved for a perfect fit.  The blade is a mangled facimile of a soul, burning in torture.  While disturbing to look at, there is an elegance to the line and aesthetic of the knife as a whole.  This knife has made more successful assassinations than most assassins even attempt in a century.

objects.short: a pair of black leather pants
objects.ground: An absolutely perfect pair of black leather pants is lying on the ground.

extras.text: What a find!  These pants fit perfectly, hiding all the bad points and accentuating all the good ones.  Though unbearably warm, they are the perfect piece of clothing to grab immediate attention and silence a room with.

triggers.name: karla_count
triggers.commands: emote takes a deep breath wait 3 say Here we go!  5, 6, 7, 8! wait 2s emote executes a flawless combination of steps. wait 1s nod Say Okay, I think I got it.

triggers.name: gnome_king_random
triggers.commands: grumble wait 1s say I sure hope we rounded up the last of those stupid monkeys...

triggers.name: gnome_king_monkeys
triggers.commands: say Yes, the Ceiling Monkeys! wait 4 mutter wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'They managed to sneak off the catwalk this afternoon and ran amuck through the theater.' wait 3s say mecho %self.name% says, 'I believe my gnomes and I managed to get them all back up into their nesting grounds.  Unfortunately, they made off with a couple of the actors' personal belongings.' wait 4s eye %actor.name% wait 5 mecho %self.name% says, 'However, you might be able to help.  Are you up to it?'

triggers.name: gnome_king_key

There's a second entrance above the balcony, but it's always locked from the other side. wait 4 say Good luck! bow %actor.name% mmobflag %self% sentinel off endif

triggers.name: chad_notgay
triggers.argument_list: Oh don't worry I can make it worth your time.

triggers.commands: emote pinches a player on the behind! wait 4 Whistle wait 3s Say Wasn't me.  I like girls.

triggers.name: nick_why

triggers.name: amy_mean

triggers.name: amy_stupid

triggers.commands: if %self.room% == 4353 && %actor.quest_stage[theatre]% == 3 wait 2 msend %actor% Fastrada tosses a sultry smile your way. mechoaround %actor% Fastrada puts on a sultry smile. wait 3 mecho %self.name% says, 'Thank you for letting me out of here.  Please, allow me to mecho &0to repay you in the future.' wink %actor.name% wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'But first things first - may I have my dressing room key back mecho &0please?' endif

triggers.name: **UNUSED**
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 mmobflag %self% sentinel on mat 4351 m_run_room_trig 4363 if %actor.quest_stage[theatre]% == 0 quest start theatre %actor% msend %actor% &7&bYou have begun the theatre quest!&0 endif set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person% == %actor% eval a %a% + 1 else if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[theatre]% == 0 quest start theatre %person% msend %person% &7&bYou have begun the theatre quest!&0 endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif endif eval a %a% + 1 done endif wait 2 grin wait 3s say Then you'll need this. mload obj 4304 wait 4 emote produces a key from his pocket. give key %actor.name% wait 3s say You should be able to reach their nest from our workshop in the back of the theater.  There's a second entrance above the balcony, but it's always locked from the other side. wait 4 say Good luck! bow %actor.name% mmobflag %self% sentinel off endif

triggers.name: charlemagne_greet
triggers.commands: if %self.room% == 4352 && %actor.quest_stage[theatre]% == 4 wait 2 emote breathes a sigh of relief. wait 1s say Finally!  I was about to break down the door to escape! wait 1s grumble wait 3s say If you have my dressing room key, please hand it over. endif

triggers.name: test trigger
triggers.commands: set person %actor% mecho person is %person.name% set i %person.group_size% mecho group size is %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% mecho we are in the while loop set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% mecho actor.group_member[a] is %person.name% if %person.room% == %self.room% mecho Person is in the room elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 mecho Person is not in the room endif eval a %a% + 1 mecho Evaluating a done mecho done

triggers.name: leading_player
triggers.commands: Wait 1s wecho The players CHEER madly!! Wait 5s wecho Turning to you, the Leading Player gestures to the burning wreckage of the fire box. wecho The Leading Player grins evilly. Wait 4s wecho The Leading Player winks as he says, 'You're one of us now kid, part of the troupe.' Wait 3s wecho The Leading Player summons the burning wreckage together, creating a small burning circle. wait 2s wecho It hovers in his outstretched hand for a moment before he lowers his hand, leaving it suspended in the air. Wait 4s wecho The Leading Player says, 'My gift to you,' as he turns to leave. set person %self.people% while %person% if %person.quest_stage[theatre]% >= 7 wload obj 4319 quest variable theatre %person% fire_ring 1 quest complete theatre %person% wforce %person% get fire-ring endif set person %person.next_in_room% done Wait 4s wecho The Leading Player blows a kiss over his shoulder and slinks off into the shadows. wait 8 wecho One by one the other players follow, slipping off into the theater. Wait 6s wecho You blink and the theater has returned to normal. set holding %get.room[1100]% if %holding.people[4399]% wat 1100 wteleport leading 4333 endif

triggers.name: The_Finale
triggers.commands: if %get.people[4336]% == 0 halt else if %get.people[4333]% set room %get.room[4333]% if %room.people[4399]% wat 4333 wteleport leading-player 1100 endif endif if %self.people[4312]% set char %self.people[4312]% else set char %self.people% endif wecho The Fire Goddess shouts, 'Ladies and Gentlemen!  We present to you a spectacle never before seen on a public stage!  The only completely perfect act in our repertoire!' Wat 4333 wecho The Fire Goddess shouts, 'Ladies and Gentlemen!  We present to you a spectacle never before seen on a public stage!  The only completely perfect act in our repertoire!' Wait 4s Wecho A chorus of voices shouts out in response, 'THE FINALE!!' Wat 4333 Wecho A chorus of voices shouts out in response, 'THE FINALE!!' Wait 5s Wecho Deep, stirring chords are struck on numerous instruments, resounding like a death knell in the box. Wat 4333 wecho Instruments strum to life all around. wait 3s wat 4333 wecho Deep, stirring chords break loose from the darkness, haunting the stage. Wecho Voices starting to sing outside the box, faintly in the distance. wait 3s Wat 4333 wecho Ghostly voices float through theater, singing and whispering unintelligibly. Wait 7s Wecho A single, strong male voice sounds out in the darkness, calling out your name, inviting you to dance. Wat 4333 wecho From the darkness of the fire box emerges the Leading Player in all his glory, inviting you to dance. Wat 4333 wecho The Leading Player stalks the room with his eyes, crooning, '%char.name%, think about the sun.' Wait 6s Wat 4333 wecho Pointing to the rafters, the Leading Player screams, 'Let's give this angel some more light!!' Wat 4333 wecho Oppressively bright light bursts down from the enormous sun on the theater ceiling. wait 6 Wecho A powerful, driving chord strikes and strikes hard! Wat 4333 wecho A powerful, driving chord strikes and strikes hard! wait 2s wecho The music starts to blast a new, driving beat. wat 4333 wecho The music starts to blast a new, driving beat. Wait 5s Wecho The rhythm starts to pick up, pounding faster and faster, drawing you into the melody, begging your body to dance. Wat 4333 wecho The players emerge from all around, moving to the now pounding rhythm. Wat 4333 wecho You find yourself swept up into the dance, unable to resist the music. wait 3s wat 4333 wecho The players swirl about you, tumbling together into a giant clump. Wait 5s Wecho Suddenly, the box begins to get hotter and hotter, the inside starting to smoke. Wat 4333 wecho Moving into a circle around the stage, the players sing, 'When the power and the glory are there at your command!' wait 3s Wat 4333 wecho They wave their rings at the fire box as the Fire Goddess heats the box with her touch. Wait 6s Wecho Lights explode through the walls of the box, sparking the wood and lighting the box on fire! Wat 4333 wecho Glowing with an inner fire as they dance, the players call out, '%char.name%!!' Wait 6s Wecho &4Br&b&3i&0&4ll&b&3ia&0&4nt&0 flash charges go off all around, exploding in a barrage of colors! Wat 4333 Wecho &4Br&b&3i&0&4ll&b&3ia&0&4nt&0 flash charges go off all around, exploding in a barrage of colors! wait 4s Wat 4333 wecho The players belt out in unison 'THINK ABOUT THE SUN!!' Wait 10 Wecho A voice cackles from the stage as the box &1E&b&3X&b&1P&0&1L&1O&b&3D&1E&0&1S&0 into flames!!!! Wat 4333 wecho The Leading Player cackles as the box &1E&b&3X&b&1P&0&1L&1O&b&3D&1E&0&1S&0 into flames!!! set person %self.people% while %person% if %person.vnum% != -1 wdamage %person% 1000 else wdamage %person% 200 endif set person %person.next_in_room% done wait 2 wteleport all 4333 wat 4333 wpurge box wat 4333 wload obj 4322 wdoor 4336 down room 4333 wait 2s wdoor 4336 down purge if %get.people[1100]% set room %get.room[1100]% if %room.people[4399]% wat 1100 wteleport leading-player 4333 endif endif endif

rooms.name: Entrance to the Theatre
rooms.description: You have entered into a magical world where peasants stand in place of kings, where witches and warlocks can endearingly twist the fates of total strangers to determine the outcome of an evening.  It's a place where the most talented performers and musicians from all walks of life come to shine for one glorious moment.  Intricate, fading designs cover the crimson red walls of the theatre.  False gold columns run the length of the walls, stretching up into the heavens.  The house waits before you to the west.

North.description: A ticket booth is built into the entryway.  People can pay a few coins to see the shows and be entertained for the evening.

Up.description: Above you hangs a giant balcony, making up the second floor of the audience seating.

extras.text: A ticket booth is built into the entryway.  People can pay a few coins to see the shows and be entertained for the evening.

rooms.name: The House
rooms.description: Beautiful red velvet seats have been attached to the floor in rows, slowly slanting down to the stage to the west.  The theatre is lit, just enough to see the aisle you're in and the one a few feet ahead of you, but your eyes are dependent on the light from the stage to see much of anything else.  The balcony overhead blocks your view of the ceiling though.  A stairway leads to the balcony above you.

extras.text: Each seat is very soft and comfortable!  Obviously, each patron needs to be comfortable enough to sit for two solid hours, which these seats definitely allow for.  Every seat in the house has an excellent view of the stage, making this an ideal space to watch a performance in.

rooms.name: The Balcony
rooms.description: The second level of the house is just as beautiful as the first, but in addition the view of the gorgeous ceiling is unobstructed.  The seats are situated in sloped rows, identical to the level below you.  Somehow, being up in the balcony liberates you, the feeling of the theatre so invigorating it brings you a little bit closer to the gods.  After all, there must be a reason theatre has been used as a ritual for centuries.  There is a stairway leading back down to the main floor.

Up.description: Above your head sits a marvelous domed ceiling.

extras.text: Just as extravagant as the detailed walls, the upper crowing of the theatre is ringed with faux gold cherubim faces, enclosing a huge dome.  At the apex of the dome is a huge relief of a golden sun, its beams blazing outward. Openings in the ceiling allow for lights to be hung and light both the house and the stage.  In a full production, the stage is lit as if by a multicolored, radiant sun.

rooms.name: In The Wings
rooms.description: You stand just off stage, hiding behind a masking curtain so you can't be seen from the house.  Looking around the backstage area, the glamour of the theatre quickly fades away to reveal the work that goes into putting on a show. All the walls are painted black to avoid any kind of attention.  Cables and ropes hang from all manners of pulleys and set pieces, ready to open this or move that or do any other number of strange, set-changing things.  Only the minds of the criminally insane technical crew could possibly grasp the workings of the strange devices here.

rooms.name: Down Stage Left
rooms.description: The front left edge of the stage is thought to be a position of ending and finality.  The old wooden stage is sturdy and well built, but has obviously been used in thousands of productions since its creation.  Standing at the front of the stage, you can only imagine the thrill a performer would feel with the eyes of every person in the theatre watching them.  From here, you can make your way off stage north or move upstage by going west.

rooms.name: Down Stage Center
rooms.description: The view of the house from here is spectacular!  You can see all the way to the back of the audience from here.  The old wooden stage is sturdy and well built, but has obviously been used in thousands of productions since its creation.  Standing at the front of the stage, you can only image the thrill a performer would feel with the eyes of every person in the theatre watching them.  You can make your way upstage by going west.

rooms.name: Down Stage Right
rooms.description: Standing at the front right edge of the stage is said to be a position of potential and beginning.  Maybe it looks that way, but it sure doesn't feel like it.  The old wooden stage is sturdy and well built, but has obviously been used in thousands of productions since its creation.  Standing at the front of the stage, you can only image the thrill a performer would feel with the eyes of every person in the theatre watching them.  From here, you can make your way off stage south or move upstage by going west.

rooms.name: In the Wings
rooms.description: You stand just off stage, hiding behind a masking curtain so you can't be seen from the house.  Looking around the backstage area, the glamour of the theatre quickly fades away to reveal the work that goes into putting on a show. All the walls are painted black to avoid any kind of attention.  Cables and ropes hang from all manners of pulleys and set pieces, ready to open this or move that or do any other number of strange, set-changing things.  Only the minds of the criminally insane technical crew could possibly grasp the workings of the strange devices here.

rooms.name: In the Wings
rooms.description: You stand just off stage, hiding behind the masking curtain so you can't be seen from the house.  Looking around the backstage area, the glamour of the theatre quickly fades away to reveal the work that goes into putting on a show in this place.  Small prop tables are set up against the walls.

extras.text: These tables are where actors are SUPPOSED to return their hand props after bringing them off stage.  Everything from a fake cigarette, which is cheap and easily replaceable, to a real steel sword, which is expensive and very, very dangerous, can qualify as a prop, so it is vital that everything be returned to its proper place.

rooms.name: Stage Left
rooms.description: You stand just off to the left of the middle of the stage.  A large curtain masks the exit from the stage, support by a tall pillar.  Strangely, you don't feel any farther from the all-seeing eyes of the audience here.  You can make your way off stage by going north or move upstage by going west.

rooms.name: Center Stage
rooms.description: A spotlight shines down on this part of the stage, the glorious center stage.  You have access to all parts of the stage here, but why would you want to move?  Here, everyone can see you.  You are the star, shining as bright as the sun.  This is called the power spot, the true center of the stage.

rooms.name: Stage Right
rooms.description: You stand just off to the right of the middle of the stage.  A large curtain masks the exit from the stage, support by a tall pillar.  Strangely, you don't feel any farther from the all-seeing eyes of the audience here.  A small tower of platforms had been constructed to give a director levels to play with. They give great visual interest, as well as several great hiding spots.  You can make your way off stage by going south or move upstage by going west, or you can climb the tower and head upstage on that instead.

Everything from a fake cigarette, which is cheap and easily replaceable, to a real steel sword, which is expensive and very, very dangerous, can qualify as a prop, so it is vital that everything be returned to its proper place.

rooms.name: In The Wings
rooms.description: You stand just off stage, hiding behind a masking curtain so you can't be seen from the house.  Looking around the backstage area, the glamour of the theatre quickly fades away to reveal the work that goes into putting on a show. All the walls are painted black to avoid any kind of attention.  The off-stage end of the on-stage balcony ends in an unpainted, unfinished platform with small, steep wooden steps cobbled together to allow an actor to get from the balcony to the ground.  There is a black door going west from here.

West.description: There is a solid black door leading out of the backstage area.

rooms.name: Up Stage Left
rooms.description: A giant set piece has been erected here in front of the upstage curtain, giving this far corner of the stage a second level so a performer can be better seen by the audience.  The set piece is a large balcony with a rail and a long metal pole stretching from the base of the stage to the ceiling.  You can make your way off stage north under the balcony.

rooms.name: Up Stage Center
rooms.description: There is nothing here except the large black curtain at the back of the stage.  There are two large set pieces that you can see, one north and one south.  Otherwise, the stage is empty.

extras.text: The curtain is slightly open, revealing something huge hidden behind it.

rooms.name: Up Stage Right
rooms.description: A giant set piece has been erected here in front of the upstage curtain, giving this far corner of the stage a second level so that a performer can be better seen by the audience.  The set piece is a series of platforms and ramps, going from the ground to the height of the stage left balcony.  Each platform looks sturdy enough to hold several performers, giving this piece a mountain-like look.  You can make your way off stage south, or you can climb the tower of platforms.

rooms.name: In the Wings
rooms.description: You stand just off stage, hiding behind a masking curtain so you can't be seen from the house.  Looking around the backstage area, the glamour of the theatre quickly fades away to reveal the work that goes into putting on a show. All the walls are painted black to avoid any kind of attention.  There is a black door going west from here.

West.description: There is a solid black door leading out of the backstage area.

rooms.name: Inside the Fire Box
rooms.description: The entire inside of the box is painted black and covered with soot.  It smells very heavily of flammable chemicals for some odd reason.  The walls and floor and also scored with scorch marks.  The door closes and seals behind you and you hear a sudden 'click' as it's locked as well.  This can't be a good place to be right now.

rooms.name: A Stairwell
rooms.description: The backstage door opens into a dimly lit stairwell that leads down under the stage.  The area below you looks brighter than the backstage area, indicating that perhaps the lower level is actually in use.  There is another door going south.

East.description: There is a solid black door leading out of the backstage area.

South.description: An old wooden door block off the backstage area.

rooms.name: Behind the Stage
rooms.description: This area is where most of the props for shows are kept.  A large number of tools wait here as well, ready to repair anything at a moment's notice. Pieces of wood that this area is probably also used for set construction as well as storage.  A good little workshop indeed!

North.description: An old wooden door block off the backstage area.

extras.text: Saws, hammers, nails, even crank drills are all around this room. Everything could be described in one of two ways: well loved or junk.

rooms.name: Behind the Stage
rooms.description: This area is where most of the props for shows are kept.  A large number of tools wait here as well, ready to repair anything at a moment's notice. Pieces of wood that this area is probably also used for set construction as well as storage.  A good little workshop indeed!

West.description: There is a ladder set into the wall, leading up to a small trapdoor in the ceiling.

extras.text: Saws, hammers, nails, even crank drills are all around this room. Everything could be described in one of two ways: well loved or junk.

rooms.name: Behind the Stage
rooms.description: This area is where most of the props for shows are kept.  A large number of tools wait here as well, ready to repair anything at a moment's notice. Pieces of wood that this area is probably also used for set construction as well as storage.  A good little workshop indeed!

South.description: An old wooden door block off the backstage area.

extras.text: Saws, hammers, nails, even crank drills are all around this room. Everything could be described in one of two ways: well loved or junk.

rooms.name: A Stairwell
rooms.description: The backstage door opens into a dimly lit stairwell that leads down under the stage.  The area below you looks brighter than the backstage area, indicating that perhaps the lower level is actually in use.  There is another door going north.

North.description: An old wooden door block off the backstage area.

East.description: There is a solid black door leading out of the backstage area.

rooms.name: A Stairwell
rooms.description: As you descend the stairs, you hear muffled voices coming through a simple door to the west.  You can go back up the stairs and to the back stage area if you want.

rooms.name: A Stairwell
rooms.description: As you descend the stairs, you hear muffled voices coming through a simple door to the west.  You can go back up the stairs and to the back stage area if you want.

West.description: A simple wooden door with the word 'Womens' written on it stands here.

rooms.name: Top of the Stage Right Tower
rooms.description: What a fantastic spot to be in!  Though it's not as focused as center stage, there's not a single eye in the house that could miss a person standing on this top platform.  Everything is visible from here, including a great view of the house balcony and anything happening on the stage left turret.  Sadly there's only one way to go from here: down.

rooms.name: Lewis's Dressing Room
rooms.description: This gaudily decorated dressing room belongs to the actor in the Role of Lewis.  Made to make the actor feel more in character, there are bodybuilding and wrestling books strewn about the room, pictures of beautiful, half-naked women hung on the walls, weights in one corner and several prop swords in the other.  However, the enormous, fashionable wardrobe and dozens of kinds of makeup make a drastic contrast to the manliness of the room.  A large mirror is set over a countertop here for the actor to check his makeup in.

extras.text: Every shade of color in the rainbow is scattered about in this dressing room.  Streaks and stains are all over the mirror and the counter.
Are those lip prints on the mirror?  Was the actor seriously kissing his own reflection?!  Something else catches your attention though.  It looks like something is poking out from behind the mirror.

rooms.name: The Men's Dressing Room
rooms.description: Entering into this area, you walk into a large room filled with racks of costumes and personal clothing.  Even with all the racks, this room is still a total mess, junk scattered all over the floor, street clothes tossed into a pile or slung over the back of a chair.  The room reeks to high Hell of dirty socks, but there is an unexpectedly comfortable, homey feeling here as well. The dressing room continues south.

North.description: There is a door leading north, a big gold star hanging on it.

West.description: The west wall is lined with a single giant mirror over a long countertop. Several stools sit under the counter, giving the actors a place to sit while they take care of their makeup and hair.

extras.text: Written on the star is the name 'Lewis'.

rooms.name: The Men's Dressing Room
rooms.description: Entering into this area, you walk into a large room filled with racks of costumes and personal clothing.  Even with all the racks, this room is still a total mess, junk scattered all over the floor, street clothes tossed into a pile or slung over the back of a chair.  The room reeks to high Hell of dirty socks, but there is an unexpectedly comfortable, homey feeling here as well. A large couch is in here as well for the actors to sit on while they wait for their cue.  However, no one has time to sit in this business.  Everyone is running around frantically, making sure all their props are in place and making sure they've warmed up for the show.  The dressing room continues south.

South.description: There is a door to thsouth, unmarked and unlocked.

West.description: The west wall is lined with a single giant mirror over a long countertop. Several stools sit under the counter, giving the actors a place to sit while they take care of their makeup and hair.  There is a door leading west at the end of the mirror, a star hanging on it.

extras.text: Written on the star is the name 'Charlemagne'.
Wow, this thing is filthy!  Talk about your second-hand goods.  Someone probably picked this up off the street and stuck it in here for lack of a better place to put it.

rooms.name: A Hallway
rooms.description: This simple white hallway connects the men's and women's dressing rooms. Doors on the north and south ends separate the two areas of the basement.

North.description: A simple wooden door with the word 'Mens' written on it stands here.

South.description: A simple wooden door with the word 'Womens' written on it stands here.

rooms.name: The Women's Dressing Room
rooms.description: This large room is filled with racks of costumes and personal clothing. However, even with all the dresses and other huge costume pieces, this room is neat and fairly clean.  It smells like fresh flowers, though the ego in this room could kill a whale.  The west wall is lined with a single giant mirror over a long countertop.  Several stools sit under the counter, giving the actresses a place to sit while they take care of their makeup and hair.  A large couch is in here as well for the actors to sit on while they wait for their cue.  However, no one has time to sit in this business.  Everyone is running around frantically, making sure all their props are in place and making sure they've warmed up for the show.

North.description: There is a door to the north, unmarked and unlocked.

West.description: There is a door leading west at the end of the mirror, a huge golden star shining on it.

extras.text: Though the actual couch is falling apart, a make-shift cover of clean sheets has been tucked over it, and a few pillows are tossed onto the couch for effect.  Fortunately, the sheets are very dark in color so most stains don't show on it, though an occasional makeup streak is visible.
Written in beautiful, flowing script is the name and title, 'Fastrada, Queen of all that is'.

rooms.name: The Women's Dressing Room
rooms.description: You enter into a large room filled with racks of dresses and dance uniforms. However, even with all the dresses and other huge costume pieces, this room is neat and fairly clean.  All of the performers' street clothes are hung carefully on a separate rack, apart from the costumes.  This dressing room smells like fresh flowers and is pleasing to the eye, but the ego in this room could kill a whale.  The dressing room continues north.

South.description: There is a door leading south, a golden star hanging on it.

West.description: The west wall is lined with a single giant mirror over a long countertop. Several stools sit under the counter, giving the actresses a place to sit while they take care of their makeup and hair.

extras.text: On the star is written 'Catherine'.

rooms.name: Catherine's Dressing Room
rooms.description: An average, ordinary kind of dressing room for an average, ordinary kind of woman.  Everything is in its place, the counter tidy and clean.  A simple bouquet of flowers is displayed on the counter in front of the mirror, all the costumes are hung neatly and carefully.  However, something seems missing. Looking around, you realize that there isn't a stool in here, nor is there any kind of makeup or even a pair of shoes.  The actress seems to have misplaced them!

rooms.name: Charlemagne's Dressing Room
rooms.description: Royal purple hangings and antique swords of all kinds adorn the walls, and there's even a bed in one corner.  Clearly, this is a room of a king!  The actor's costumes are haphazardly thrown on the costume rack, his makeup scattered around in front of his mirror.  The mirror is dirty, smeared with makeup and dust.  The bed is messy from use, though that could have happened years ago, given how clean this place is.  Posters and notes are tacked up all around the room.

extras.text: Tacked on one of the walls is a large piece of paper that reads, 'The part is to be portrayed by an actor of enormous power!  ' The actor has obviously let the 'power' go to his head.

rooms.name: Fastrada's Dressing Room
rooms.description: This room is perfect.  Too perfect.  Perfectly decorated, perfectly kept, and everything is neat and very, very clean.  Something feels very amiss here, though what it is you can't quite place your finger on...  It's almost sinister in nature.  This of course isn't helped by the large book sitting on the counter, titled, '101 Ways to Bake Cookies and Kill Your Husband'.  Perhaps a few of these actors are taking their roles a little too seriously. Extravagance attempts to hide the deceit in this room; beautifully colored tapestries adorn the walls, accented by rich red roses and brilliant gold jewelry.  No expense was spared in the decorations.

extras.text: Quick, easy recipies are combined with every happy homemaker's desire to make her husband both happy and dead.  Seditious plots against every Emperor in history are laid out in detail, along with suggested deviations to '...  Keep your homemade plot from becoming too cliche and most importantly, too noticeable.  ' What kind of housewife and mother could possibly need a book like this?

rooms.name: The Catwalk
rooms.description: Using this rickety catwalk, one can get quickly get from the balcony in the house to the shop behind the stage.  From the catwalk hang lights that illuminate the theatre and the stage.  Unfortunately it is that dark up here and strange noises echo in the darkness.  One noise in particular sounds like grunting, but there can't be anything very large up here, can there?  Surely only a brave soul would be able to spend an entire performance up here!  There is a ladder leading down from the catwalk to a trapdoor to the balcony here. The catwalk continues to the west.

Down.description: A small padlock seals up a trapdoor leading down off the catwalk.

rooms.name: The Catwalk
rooms.description: A rickety catwalk hangs over the theatre here.  Using this, one can get quickly get from the balcony in the house to the shop behind the stage. However, it's very dark up here and strange noises echo from the darkness. One noise in particular sounds like a grunting, but there can't be anything very large up here, can there?  From the catwalk hang lights that illuminate the theatre and the stage.  Surely only a brave soul would be able to spend an entire performance up here, making sure things go smoothly.

Down.description: It appears this catwalk hangs above the domed ceiling of the house, obscuring it from sight.  Only the occasional opening below you allows a glimpse at the house below.

rooms.name: The Catwalk
rooms.description: A rickety catwalk hangs over the theatre here.  Using this, one can get quickly get from the balcony in the house to the shop behind the stage. However, it's very dark up here and strange noises echo from the darkness. One noise in particular sounds like a grunting, but there can't be anything very large up here, can there?  From the catwalk hang lights that illuminate the theatre and the stage.  Surely only a brave soul would be able to spend an entire performance up here, making sure things go smoothly.

rooms.name: Above the Stage
rooms.description: This loft hangs nearly fifty feet above the stage below you!  From here one can hang lights and set pieces, which can then be 'flown' down to the stage by the pulley system in the ceiling.  The loft is littered with small piles of garbage, like someone has been collecting random stuff and leaving it to rot or collect dust up here.

Down.description: Nothing rests between you and the stage far below you.  Perhaps looking down isn't a good idea.

extras.text: Old costumes, parts of old sets, rotten food, pages from old scripts, even production posters litter the loft.  A couple of the piles have been pushed together though, almost like something was using them as a bed.

From here one can hang lights and set pieces, which can then be 'flown' down to the stage by the pulley system in the ceiling.  The loft is littered with small piles of garbage, like someone has been collecting random stuff and leaving it to rot or collect dust up here.  A long ladder stretches from the west end of the loft to the storage room behind the stage.

extras.text: Old costumes, parts of old sets, rotten food, pages from old scripts, even production posters litter the loft.  A couple of the piles have been pushed together though, almost like something was using them as a bed.

extras.text: Old costumes, parts of old sets, rotten food, pages from old scripts, even production posters litter the loft.  A couple of the piles have been pushed together though, almost like something was using them as a bed.

rooms.name: The Ladder Above the Shop
rooms.description: This long ladder, which is securely set into the wall, is the only way from the storage room to the catwalk above the stage.  Just above you is a trapdoor. It looks like going down will land you behind the stage.

rooms.name: Up Stage Left Balcony
rooms.description: From the front, this set piece is painted looks like a turret or a tower balcony.  From the back, this is clearly just a huge pile of lumber and plywood.  It leads off stage to the west, allowing an actor to enter or exit into the shadows.  A solid metal pole runs from the ceiling down to the floor so someone can quickly get to the stage floor, about fifteen feet below, without going off stage.

rooms.name: Middle of the Stage Right Tower
rooms.description: The tower is in truth an abstract set piece, not looking like anything in particular normally, but could easily be dressed as something fun and wild.  A larger platform sits about half way up the tower, extending east to the middle of the stage.  This is a great location to see from, letting you look out over almost the entire stage.

rooms.name: On a Tower of Platforms
rooms.description: A series of steps leads up about eight feet to a single large platform. From this elevated position, it's much easier to be seen and to see more of the action on the rest of the stage.  The tower is in truth an abstract set piece, not looking like anything in particular normally, but could easily be dressed as something fun and wild.

rooms.name: The Rehearsal Studio
rooms.description: The underbelly of the theatre isn't nearly the seedy den of iniquity one might expect.  Being built below the crenelations of Festival Street however, just beyond the walls is the open sky, allowing natural light in the lower level through small windows.  It's not exactly bright, but it's not impossible to see either.  The rehearsal studio takes up most of the lower level.  The floor is sprung wood, ideal for dancing.  Floor to ceiling mirrors cover one wall making it easy for an actor to see what they might look like from the audience.  Props, scenery, and costumes are stored in various places down here, certainly home to more than a few rats.  At the far end of the room serves as the business office for the Leading Player, leader of the troupe.

Up.description: You can make your way back up to the stage from here.
